name: NSMutableData
desc: A dynamic byte buffer that bridges to Data; use NSMutableData when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

items.name: mutableBytes
items.desc: A pointer to the data contained by the mutable data object.

items.name: length
items.desc: The number of bytes contained in the mutable data object.

items.name: append
items.desc: Appends to the receiver a given number of bytes from a given buffer.

items.name: append
items.desc: Appends the content of another data object to the receiver.

items.name: increaseLength
items.desc: Increases the length of the receiver by a given number of bytes.

items.name: replaceBytes
items.desc: Replaces with a given set of bytes a given range within the contents of the receiver.

items.name: replaceBytes
items.desc: Replaces with a given set of bytes a given range within the contents of the receiver.

items.name: resetBytes
items.desc: Replaces with zeroes the contents of the receiver in a given range.

items.name: setData
items.desc: Replaces the entire contents of the receiver with the contents of another data object.
